00040 typedef struct TextInputColors
00041 {
00042       //internal values that contain all of the colors for the text editing fields.
00043       UINT16 usFont;
00044       UINT16 usTextFieldColor;
00045       UINT8 ubForeColor, ubShadowColor;
00046       UINT8 ubHiForeColor, ubHiShadowColor, ubHiBackColor;
00047       //optional -- no bevelling by default
00048       BOOLEAN     fBevelling;
00049       UINT16 usBrighterColor, usDarkerColor;
00050       //optional -- cursor color defaults to black
00051       UINT16 usCursorColor;
00052       //optional colors for disabled fields (defaults to 25% darker shading)
00053       BOOLEAN fUseDisabledAutoShade;
00054       UINT8 ubDisabledForeColor;
00055       UINT8 ubDisabledShadowColor;
00056       UINT16 usDisabledTextFieldColor;
00057 }TextInputColors;

00075 //Stack list containing the head nodes of each level.  Only the top level is the active level.

00077 {

00103 //Saves the current text input mode by pushing it onto our stack, then starts a new
00104 //one.
00105 void PushTextInputLevel()
00106 {
00107       STACKTEXTINPUTNODE *pNewLevel;
00108       pNewLevel = (STACKTEXTINPUTNODE*)MemAlloc( sizeof( STACKTEXTINPUTNODE ) );
00109       Assert( pNewLevel );
00110       pNewLevel->head = gpTextInputHead;
00111       pNewLevel->pColors = pColors;
00112       pNewLevel->next = pInputStack;
00113       pInputStack = pNewLevel;
00114       DisableAllTextFields();
00115 }
00116 
00117 //After the currently text input mode is removed, we then restore the previous one
00118 //automatically.  Assert failure in this function will expose cases where you are trigger 
00119 //happy with killing non-existant text input modes.
00120 void PopTextInputLevel()
00121 {
00122       STACKTEXTINPUTNODE *pLevel;
00123       gpTextInputHead = pInputStack->head;
00124       pColors = pInputStack->pColors;
00125       pLevel = pInputStack;
00126       pInputStack = pInputStack->next;
00127       MemFree( pLevel );
00128       pLevel = NULL;
00129       EnableAllTextFields();
00130 }

00146 //Simply initiates that you wish to begin inputting text.  This should only apply to screen
00147 //initializations that contain fields that edit text.  It also verifies and clears any existing
00148 //fields.  Your input loop must contain the function HandleTextInput and processed if the gfTextInputMode
00149 //flag is set else process your regular input handler.  Note that this doesn't mean you are necessarily typing,
00150 //just that there are text fields in your screen and may be inactive.  The TAB key cycles through your text fields, 
00151 //and special fields can be defined which will call a void functionName( UINT16 usFieldNum ) 
00152 void InitTextInputMode()
00153 {
00154       if( gpTextInputHead )
00155       {
00156             //Instead of killing all of the currently existing text input fields, they will now (Jan16 '97)
00157             //be pushed onto a stack, and preserved until we are finished with the new mode when they will
00158             //automatically be re-instated when the new text input mode is killed.
00159             PushTextInputLevel();
00160             //KillTextInputMode();
00161       }
00162       gpTextInputHead = NULL;
00163       pColors = (TextInputColors*)MemAlloc( sizeof( TextInputColors ) );
00164       Assert( pColors );
00165       gfTextInputMode = TRUE;
00166       gfEditingText = FALSE;
00167       pColors->fBevelling = FALSE;
00168       pColors->fUseDisabledAutoShade = TRUE;
00169       pColors->usCursorColor = 0;
00170 }
00171 
00172 //A hybrid version of InitTextInput() which uses a specific scheme.  JA2's editor uses scheme 1, so
00173 //feel free to add new schemes.
00174 void InitTextInputModeWithScheme( UINT8 ubSchemeID )
00175 {
00176       InitTextInputMode();
00177       switch( ubSchemeID )
00178       {
00179             case DEFAULT_SCHEME:  //yellow boxes with black text, with bluish bevelling
00180                   SetTextInputFont( (UINT16)FONT12POINT1 );
00181                   Set16BPPTextFieldColor( Get16BPPColor(FROMRGB(250, 240, 188) ) );
00182                   SetBevelColors( Get16BPPColor(FROMRGB(136, 138, 135)), Get16BPPColor(FROMRGB(24, 61, 81)) );
00183                   SetTextInputRegularColors( FONT_BLACK, FONT_BLACK ); 
00184                   SetTextInputHilitedColors( FONT_GRAY2, FONT_GRAY2, FONT_METALGRAY );
00185                   break;
00186       }
00187 }
00188 
00189 //Clears any existing fields, and ends text input mode.
00190 void KillTextInputMode()
00191 {
00192       TEXTINPUTNODE *curr;
00193       if( !gpTextInputHead )
00194 //          AssertMsg( 0, "Called KillTextInputMode() without any text input mode defined.");
00195             return;
00196       curr = gpTextInputHead;
00197       while( curr )
00198       {
00199             gpTextInputHead = gpTextInputHead->next;
00200             if( curr->szString )
00201             {
00202                   MemFree( curr->szString );
00203                   curr->szString = NULL;
00204                   MSYS_RemoveRegion( &curr->region );
00205             }
00206             MemFree( curr );
00207             curr = gpTextInputHead;
00208       }
00209       MemFree( pColors );
00210       pColors = NULL;
00211       gpTextInputHead = NULL;
00212       if( pInputStack )
00213       {
00214             PopTextInputLevel();
00215             SetActiveField( 0 );
00216       }
00217       else
00218       {
00219             gfTextInputMode = FALSE;
00220             gfEditingText = FALSE;
00221       }
00222 
00223       if( !gpTextInputHead )
00224             gpActive = NULL;
00225 }
00226 
00227 //Kills all levels of text input modes.  When you init a second consecutive text input mode, without
00228 //first removing them, the existing mode will be preserved.  This function removes all of them in one
00229 //call, though doing so "may" reflect poor coding style, though I haven't thought about any really
00230 //just uses for it :(
00231 void KillAllTextInputModes()
00232 {
00233       while( gpTextInputHead )
00234             KillTextInputMode();
00235 }
00236 
00237 //After calling InitTextInputMode, you want to define one or more text input fields.  The order
00238 //of calls to this function dictate the TAB order from traversing from one field to the next.  This
00239 //function adds mouse regions and processes them for you, as well as deleting them when you are done.
00240 void AddTextInputField( INT16 sLeft, INT16 sTop, INT16 sWidth, INT16 sHeight, INT8 bPriority, 
00241                                                                     UINT16 *szInitText, UINT8 ubMaxChars, UINT16 usInputType )
00242 {
00243       TEXTINPUTNODE *pNode;
00244       pNode = (TEXTINPUTNODE*)MemAlloc(sizeof(TEXTINPUTNODE));
00245       Assert(pNode);
00246       memset( pNode, 0, sizeof( TEXTINPUTNODE ) );
00247       pNode->next = NULL;
00248   if( !gpTextInputHead ) //first entry, so we start with text input.
00249       {
00250             gfEditingText = TRUE;
00251             gpTextInputHead = gpTextInputTail = pNode;
00252             pNode->prev = NULL;
00253             pNode->ubID = 0;
00254             gpActive = pNode;
00255       }
00256       else //add to the end of the list.
00257       {
00258             gpTextInputTail->next = pNode;
00259             pNode->prev = gpTextInputTail;
00260             pNode->ubID = (UINT8)(gpTextInputTail->ubID+1);
00261             gpTextInputTail = gpTextInputTail->next;
00262       }
00263       //Setup the information for the node
00264       pNode->usInputType = usInputType;   //setup the filter type
00265       //All 24hourclock inputtypes have 6 characters.  01:23 (null terminated)
00266       if( usInputType == INPUTTYPE_EXCLUSIVE_24HOURCLOCK )
00267             ubMaxChars = 6;
00268       //Allocate and copy the string.
00269       pNode->szString = (UINT16*)MemAlloc( (ubMaxChars+1)*sizeof(UINT16) );
00270       Assert( pNode->szString );
00271       if( szInitText )
00272       {
00273             pNode->ubStrLen = (UINT8)wcslen( szInitText );        
00274             Assert( pNode->ubStrLen <= ubMaxChars );
00275             swprintf( pNode->szString, szInitText );
00276       }
00277       else
00278       {
00279             pNode->ubStrLen = 0;
00280             swprintf( pNode->szString, L"" );
00281       }
00282       pNode->ubMaxChars = ubMaxChars; //max string length
00283 
00284       //if this is the first field, then hilight it.
00285       if( gpTextInputHead == pNode )
00286       {
00287             gubStartHilite = 0;
00288             gubEndHilite = pNode->ubStrLen;
00289             gubCursorPos = pNode->ubStrLen;
00290             gfHiliteMode = TRUE;
00291       }
00292       pNode->fUserField = FALSE;
00293       pNode->fEnabled = TRUE;
00294       //Setup the region.
00295       MSYS_DefineRegion( &pNode->region, sLeft, sTop, (INT16)(sLeft+sWidth), (INT16)(sTop+sHeight), bPriority,
00296                                      gusTextInputCursor, MouseMovedInTextRegionCallback, MouseClickedInTextRegionCallback ); 
00297       MSYS_SetRegionUserData( &pNode->region, 0, pNode->ubID );
00298 }
00299 
00300 //This allows you to insert special processing functions and modes that can't be determined here.  An example 
00301 //would be a file dialog where there would be a file list.  This file list would be accessed using the Win95 
00302 //convention by pressing TAB.  In there, your key presses would be handled differently and by adding a userinput
00303 //field, you can make this hook into your function to accomplish this.  In a filedialog, alpha characters 
00304 //would be used to jump to the file starting with that letter, and setting the field in the text input 
00305 //field.  Pressing TAB again would place you back in the text input field.  All of that stuff would be handled
00306 //externally, except for the TAB keys.
00307 void AddUserInputField( INPUT_CALLBACK userFunction )
00308 {
00309       TEXTINPUTNODE *pNode;
00310       pNode = (TEXTINPUTNODE*)MemAlloc(sizeof(TEXTINPUTNODE));
00311       Assert(pNode);
00312       pNode->next = NULL;
00313   if( !gpTextInputHead ) //first entry, so we don't start with text input.
00314       {
00315             gfEditingText = FALSE;
00316             gpTextInputHead = gpTextInputTail = pNode;
00317             pNode->prev = NULL;
00318             pNode->ubID = 0;
00319             gpActive = pNode;
00320       }
00321       else //add to the end of the list.
00322       {
00323             gpTextInputTail->next = pNode;
00324             pNode->prev = gpTextInputTail;
00325             pNode->ubID = (UINT8)(gpTextInputTail->ubID+1);
00326             gpTextInputTail = gpTextInputTail->next;
00327       }
00328       //Setup the information for the node
00329       pNode->fUserField = TRUE;
00330       pNode->szString = NULL;
00331       pNode->fEnabled = TRUE;
00332       //Setup the callback
00333       pNode->InputCallback = userFunction;
00334 }
00335 
00336 //Removes the specified field from the existing fields.  If it doesn't exist, then there will be an 
00337 //assertion failure.
00338 void RemoveTextInputField( UINT8 ubField )
00339 {
00340       TEXTINPUTNODE *curr;
00341       curr = gpTextInputHead;
00342       while( curr )
00343       {
00344             if( curr->ubID == ubField )
00345             {
00346                   if( curr == gpActive )
00347                         SelectNextField();
00348                   if( curr == gpTextInputHead )
00349                         gpTextInputHead = gpTextInputHead->next;
00350                   //Detach the node.
00351                   if( curr->next )
00352                         curr->next->prev = curr->prev;
00353                   if( curr->prev )
00354                         curr->prev->next = curr->next;
00355                   if( curr->szString )
00356                   {
00357                         MemFree( curr->szString );
00358                         curr->szString = NULL;
00359                         MSYS_RemoveRegion( &curr->region );
00360                   }
00361                   MemFree( curr );
00362                   curr = NULL;
00363                   if( !gpTextInputHead )
00364                   {
00365                         gfTextInputMode = FALSE;
00366                         gfEditingText = FALSE;
00367                   }
00368                   return;
00369             }
00370             curr = curr->next;
00371       }
00372       AssertMsg( 0, "Attempt to remove a text input field that doesn't exist.  Check your IDs." );
00373 }

00375 //Returns the gpActive field ID number.  It'll return -1 if no field is active.
00376 INT16 GetActiveFieldID()
00377 {
00378       if( gpActive )
00379             return gpActive->ubID;
00380       return -1;
00381 }

00383 //This is a useful call made from an external user input field.  Using the previous file dialog example, this
00384 //call would be made when the user selected a different filename in the list via clicking or scrolling with
00385 //the arrows, or even using alpha chars to jump to the appropriate filename.
00386 void SetInputFieldStringWith16BitString( UINT8 ubField, UINT16 *szNewText )
00387 {
00388       TEXTINPUTNODE *curr;
00389   curr = gpTextInputHead;
00390       while( curr )
00391       {
00392             if( curr->ubID == ubField )
00393             {
00394                   if( szNewText)
00395                   {
00396                         curr->ubStrLen = (UINT8)wcslen( szNewText );
00397                         Assert( curr->ubStrLen <= curr->ubMaxChars );
00398                         swprintf( curr->szString, szNewText );
00399                   }
00400                   else if( !curr->fUserField )
00401                   {
00402                         curr->ubStrLen = 0;
00403                         swprintf( curr->szString, L"");
00404                   }
00405                   else
00406                   {
00407                         AssertMsg( 0, String( "Attempting to illegally set text into user field %d", curr->ubID ) );
00408                   }
00409                   return;
00410             }
00411             curr = curr->next;
00412       }
00413 }

00425                         curr->ubStrLen = (UINT8)strlen( szNewText );
00426                         Assert( curr->ubStrLen <= curr->ubMaxChars );
00427                         swprintf( curr->szString, L"%S", szNewText );
00428                   }
00429                   else if( !curr->fUserField )
00430                   {
00431                         curr->ubStrLen = 0;
00432                         swprintf( curr->szString, L"" );
00433                   }
00434                   else
00435                   {
00436                         AssertMsg( 0, String( "Attempting to illegally set text into user field %d", curr->ubID ) );
00437                   }
00438                   return;
00439             }
00440             curr = curr->next;
00441       }
00442 }

00444 //Allows external functions to access the strings within the fields at anytime.
00445 void Get8BitStringFromField( UINT8 ubField, UINT8 *szString )
00446 {
00447       TEXTINPUTNODE *curr;
00448   curr = gpTextInputHead;
00449       while( curr )
00450       {
00451             if( curr->ubID == ubField )
00452             {
00453                   sprintf( (char *)szString, "%S", curr->szString );
00454                   return;
00455             }
00456             curr = curr->next;
00457       }
00458       szString[0] = '\0';
00459 }

00477 //Converts the field's string into a number, then returns that number
00478 //returns -1 if blank or invalid.  Only works for positive numbers.
00479 INT32 GetNumericStrictValueFromField( UINT8 ubField )
00480 {
00481       UINT16 *ptr;
00482       UINT16 str[20];
00483       INT32 total;
00484       Get16BitStringFromField( ubField, str );
00485       //Blank string, so return -1
00486       if( str[0] == '\0' )
00487             return -1;
00488       //Convert the string to a number.  Don't trust other functions.  This will
00489       //ensure that nonnumeric values automatically return -1.
00490       total = 0;
00491       ptr = str;
00492       while( *ptr != '\0' )                                                   //if char is a valid char...
00493       {
00494             if( *ptr >= '0' && *ptr <= '9' )          //...make sure it is numeric...
00495             {     //Multiply prev total by 10 and add converted char digit value.
00496                   total = total * 10 + (*ptr - '0');  
00497             }
00498             else                                                                                            //...else the string is invalid.
00499                   return -1;
00500             ptr++;      //point to next char in string.
00501       }
00502       return total; //if we made it this far, then we have a valid number.
00503 }
00504 
00505 //Converts a number to a numeric strict value.  If the number is negative, the 
00506 //field will be blank.
00507 void SetInputFieldStringWithNumericStrictValue( UINT8 ubField, INT32 iNumber )
00508 {
00509       TEXTINPUTNODE *curr;
00510       curr = gpTextInputHead;
00511       while( curr )
00512       {
00513             if( curr->ubID == ubField )
00514             {
00515                   if( curr->fUserField )
00516                         AssertMsg( 0, String( "Attempting to illegally set text into user field %d", curr->ubID ) );
00517                   if( iNumber < 0 ) //negative number converts to blank string
00518                         swprintf( curr->szString, L"" );
00519                   else 
00520                   {
00521                         INT32 iMax = (INT32)pow( 10.0, curr->ubMaxChars );
00522                         if( iNumber > iMax ) //set string to max value based on number of chars.
00523                               swprintf( curr->szString, L"%d", iMax - 1 );
00524                         else  //set string to the number given
00525                               swprintf( curr->szString, L"%d", iNumber );
00526                   }
00527                   curr->ubStrLen = (UINT8)wcslen( curr->szString );
00528                   return;
00529             }           
00530             curr = curr->next;
00531       }
00532 }
00533 
00534 //Sets the active field to the specified ID passed.
00535 void SetActiveField( UINT8 ubField )
00536 {
00537       TEXTINPUTNODE *curr;
00538       curr = gpTextInputHead;
00539       while( curr )
00540       {
00541             if( curr != gpActive && curr->ubID == ubField && curr->fEnabled )
00542             {
00543                   gpActive = curr;
00544                   if( gpActive->szString )
00545                   {
00546                         gubStartHilite = 0;
00547                         gubEndHilite = gpActive->ubStrLen;
00548                         gubCursorPos = gpActive->ubStrLen;
00549                         gfHiliteMode = TRUE;
00550                         gfEditingText = TRUE;
00551                   }
00552                   else
00553                   {
00554                         gfHiliteMode = FALSE;
00555                         gfEditingText = FALSE;
00556                         if( gpActive->InputCallback )
00557                               (gpActive->InputCallback)(gpActive->ubID, TRUE);
00558                   }
00559                   return;
00560             }
00561             curr = curr->next;
00562       }
00563 }
00564 
00565 void SelectNextField()
00566 {
00567       BOOLEAN fDone = FALSE;
00568       TEXTINPUTNODE *pStart;
00569 
00570       if( !gpActive )
00571             return;
00572       if( gpActive->szString )
00573             RenderInactiveTextFieldNode( gpActive );
00574       else if( gpActive->InputCallback )
00575             (gpActive->InputCallback)(gpActive->ubID, FALSE );
00576       pStart = gpActive;
00577       while( !fDone )
00578       {
00579             gpActive = gpActive->next;
00580             if( !gpActive )
00581                   gpActive = gpTextInputHead;
00582             if( gpActive->fEnabled )
00583             {
00584                   fDone = TRUE;
00585                   if( gpActive->szString )
00586                   {
00587                         gubStartHilite = 0;
00588                         gubEndHilite = gpActive->ubStrLen;
00589                         gubCursorPos = gpActive->ubStrLen;
00590                         gfHiliteMode = TRUE;
00591                         gfEditingText = TRUE;
00592                   }
00593                   else
00594                   {
00595                         gfHiliteMode = FALSE;
00596                         gfEditingText = FALSE;
00597                         if( gpActive->InputCallback )
00598                               (gpActive->InputCallback)(gpActive->ubID, TRUE);
00599                   }
00600             }
00601             if( gpActive == pStart )
00602             {
00603                   gfEditingText = FALSE;
00604                   return;
00605             }
00606       }
00607 }
00608 
00609 void SelectPrevField()
00610 {
00611       BOOLEAN fDone = FALSE;
00612       TEXTINPUTNODE *pStart;
00613 
00614       if( !gpActive )
00615             return;
00616       if( gpActive->szString )
00617             RenderInactiveTextFieldNode( gpActive );
00618       else if( gpActive->InputCallback )
00619             (gpActive->InputCallback)(gpActive->ubID, FALSE );
00620       pStart = gpActive;
00621       while( !fDone )
00622       {
00623             gpActive = gpActive->prev;
00624             if( !gpActive )
00625                   gpActive = gpTextInputTail;
00626             if( gpActive->fEnabled )
00627             {
00628                   fDone = TRUE;
00629                   if( gpActive->szString )
00630                   {
00631                         gubStartHilite = 0;
00632                         gubEndHilite = gpActive->ubStrLen;
00633                         gubCursorPos = gpActive->ubStrLen;
00634                         gfHiliteMode = TRUE;
00635                         gfEditingText = TRUE;
00636                   }
00637                   else
00638                   {
00639                         gfHiliteMode = FALSE;
00640                         gfEditingText = FALSE;
00641                         if( gpActive->InputCallback )
00642                               (gpActive->InputCallback)(gpActive->ubID, TRUE);
00643                   }
00644             }
00645             if( gpActive == pStart )
00646             {
00647                   gfEditingText = FALSE;
00648                   return;
00649             }
00650       }
00651 }
00652 
00653 //These allow you to customize the general color scheme of your text input boxes.  I am assuming that
00654 //under no circumstances would a user want a different color for each field.  It follows the Win95 convention
00655 //that all text input boxes are exactly the same color scheme.  However, these colors can be set at anytime,
00656 //but will effect all of the colors.
00657 void SetTextInputFont( UINT16 usFont )
00658 {
00659       pColors->usFont = usFont;
00660 }
00661 
00662 void Set16BPPTextFieldColor( UINT16 usTextFieldColor )
00663 {
00664       pColors->usTextFieldColor = usTextFieldColor;
00665 }
00666 
00667 void SetTextInputRegularColors( UINT8 ubForeColor, UINT8 ubShadowColor )
00668 {
00669       pColors->ubForeColor = ubForeColor;
00670       pColors->ubShadowColor = ubShadowColor;
00671 }
00672 
00673 void SetTextInputHilitedColors( UINT8 ubForeColor, UINT8 ubShadowColor, UINT8 ubBackColor )
00674 {
00675       pColors->ubHiForeColor = ubForeColor;
00676       pColors->ubHiShadowColor = ubShadowColor;
00677       pColors->ubHiBackColor = ubBackColor;
00678 }
00679 
00680 void SetDisabledTextFieldColors( UINT8 ubForeColor, UINT8 ubShadowColor, UINT16 usTextFieldColor )
00681 {
00682       pColors->fUseDisabledAutoShade = FALSE;
00683       pColors->ubDisabledForeColor = ubForeColor;
00684       pColors->ubDisabledShadowColor = ubShadowColor;
00685       pColors->usDisabledTextFieldColor = usTextFieldColor;
00686 }
00687

00689 {
00690       pColors->fBevelling = TRUE;
00691       pColors->usBrighterColor = usBrighterColor;
00692       pColors->usDarkerColor = usDarkerColor;
00693 }

00698 }
00699 
00700 //All CTRL and ALT keys combinations, F1-F12 keys, ENTER and ESC are ignored allowing 
00701 //processing to be done with your own input handler.  Otherwise, the keyboard event
00702 //is absorbed by this input handler, if used in the appropriate manner.
00703 //This call must be added at the beginning of your input handler in this format:
00704 //while( DequeueEvent(&Event) )
00705 //{
00706 //    if(   !HandleTextInput( &Event ) && (your conditions...ex:  Event.usEvent == KEY_DOWN ) )
00707 //  {
00708 //          switch( Event.usParam )
00709 //          {
00710 //                //Normal key cases here.
00711 //          }
00712 //    }
00713 //}
00714 //It is only necessary for event loops that contain text input fields.
00715 BOOLEAN HandleTextInput( InputAtom *Event )
00716 {
00717       //Check the multitude of terminating conditions...
00718 
00719       //not in text input mode
00720       gfNoScroll = FALSE;
00721       if( !gfTextInputMode ) 
00722             return FALSE; 
00723       //currently in a user field, so return unless TAB or SHIFT_TAB are pressed.
00724       if( !gfEditingText && Event->usParam != TAB && Event->usParam != SHIFT_TAB ) 
00725             return FALSE; 
00726       //unless we are psycho typers, we only want to process these key events.
00727       if( Event->usEvent != KEY_DOWN && Event->usEvent != KEY_REPEAT )
00728             return FALSE;
00729       //ESC and ENTER must be handled externally, due to the infinite uses for it.
00730       //When editing text, ESC is equivalent to cancel, and ENTER is to confirm.
00731       if( Event->usParam == ESC )
00732             return FALSE;
00733       if( Event->usParam == ENTER )
00734       {
00735             PlayJA2Sample( REMOVING_TEXT, RATE_11025, BTNVOLUME, 1, MIDDLEPAN );
00736             return FALSE;
00737       }
00738       //For any number of reasons, these ALT and CTRL combination key presses
00739       //will be processed externally
00740 #if 0
00741       if( Event->usKeyState & CTRL_DOWN  )
00742       {
00743             if( Event->usParam == 'c' || Event->usParam == 'C' )
00744             {
00745                   ExecuteCopyCommand();
00746                   return TRUE;
00747             }
00748             else if( Event->usParam == 'x' || Event->usParam == 'X' )
00749             {
00750                   ExecuteCutCommand();
00751                   return TRUE;
00752             }
00753             else if( Event->usParam == 'v' || Event->usParam == 'V' )
00754             {
00755                   ExecutePasteCommand();
00756                   return TRUE;
00757             }
00758       }
00759 #endif
00760       if( Event->usKeyState & ALT_DOWN || Event->usKeyState & CTRL_DOWN && Event->usParam != DEL )
00761             return FALSE;
00762       //F1-F12 regardless of state are processed externally as well.
00763       if( Event->usParam >= F1                   && Event->usParam <= F12                       || 
00764               Event->usParam >= SHIFT_F1 && Event->usParam <= SHIFT_F12 )
00765       {
00766             return FALSE;
00767       }
00768       if( Event->usParam == '%' || Event->usParam == '\\' )
00769       { //Input system doesn't support strings that are format specifiers.
00770             return FALSE;
00771       }
00772       //If we have met all of the conditions, we then have a valid key press
00773       //which will be handled universally for all text input fields
00774       switch( Event->usParam )
00775       {
00776             case TAB:
00777                   //Always selects the next field, even when a user defined field is currently selected.
00778                   //The order in which you add your text and user fields dictates the cycling order when
00779                   //TAB is pressed.
00780                   SelectNextField();
00781                   break;
00782             case SHIFT_TAB:
00783                   //Same as TAB, but selects fields in reverse order.
00784                   SelectPrevField();
00785                   break;
00786             case LEFTARROW:
00787                   //Move the cursor to the left one position.  If there is selected text,
00788                   //the cursor moves to the left of the block, and clears the block.
00789                   gfNoScroll = TRUE;
00790                   if( gfHiliteMode )
00791                   {
00792                         gfHiliteMode = FALSE;
00793                         gubCursorPos = gubStartHilite;
00794                         break;
00795                   }
00796                   if( gubCursorPos )
00797                         gubCursorPos--;
00798                   break;
00799             case RIGHTARROW:
00800                   //Move the cursor to the right one position.  If there is selected text,
00801                   //the block is cleared.
00802                   gfNoScroll = TRUE;
00803                   if( gfHiliteMode )
00804                   {
00805                         gfHiliteMode = FALSE;
00806                         gubCursorPos = gubEndHilite;
00807                         break;
00808                   }
00809                   if( gubCursorPos < gpActive->ubStrLen )
00810                         gubCursorPos++;
00811                   break;
00812             case END:
00813                   //Any hilighting is cleared and the cursor moves to the end of the text.
00814                   gfHiliteMode = FALSE;
00815                   gubCursorPos = gpActive->ubStrLen;
00816                   break;
00817             case HOME:
00818                   //Any hilighting is cleared and the cursor moves to the beginning of the line.
00819                   gfHiliteMode = FALSE;
00820                   gubCursorPos = 0;
00821                   break;
00822             case SHIFT_LEFTARROW:
00823                   //Initiates or continues hilighting to the left one position.  If the cursor
00824                   //is at the left end of the block, then the block decreases one position.
00825                   gfNoScroll = TRUE;
00826                   if( !gfHiliteMode )
00827                   {
00828                         gfHiliteMode = TRUE;
00829                         gubStartHilite = gubCursorPos;
00830                   }
00831                   if( gubCursorPos )
00832                         gubCursorPos--;
00833                   gubEndHilite = gubCursorPos;
00834                   break;
00835             case SHIFT_RIGHTARROW:
00836                   //Initiates or continues hilighting to the right one position.  If the cursor
00837                   //is at the right end of the block, then the block decreases one position.
00838                   gfNoScroll = TRUE;
00839                   if( !gfHiliteMode )
00840                   {
00841                         gfHiliteMode = TRUE;
00842                         gubStartHilite = gubCursorPos;
00843                   }
00844                   if( gubCursorPos < gpActive->ubStrLen )
00845                         gubCursorPos++;
00846                   gubEndHilite = gubCursorPos;
00847                   break;
00848             case SHIFT_END:
00849                   //From the location of the anchored cursor for hilighting, the cursor goes to
00850                   //the end of the text, selecting all text from the anchor to the end of the text.
00851                   if( !gfHiliteMode )
00852                   {
00853                         gfHiliteMode = TRUE;
00854                         gubStartHilite = gubCursorPos;
00855                   }
00856                   gubCursorPos = gpActive->ubStrLen;
00857                   gubEndHilite = gubCursorPos;
00858                   break;
00859             case SHIFT_HOME:
00860                   //From the location of the anchored cursor for hilighting, the cursor goes to 
00861                   //the beginning of the text, selecting all text from the anchor to the beginning
00862                   //of the text.
00863                   if( !gfHiliteMode )
00864                   {
00865                         gfHiliteMode = TRUE;
00866                         gubStartHilite = gubCursorPos;
00867                   }
00868                   gubCursorPos = 0;
00869                   gubEndHilite = gubCursorPos;
00870                   break;
00871             case DEL:
00872                   //CTRL+DEL will delete the entire text field, regardless of hilighting.
00873                   //DEL will either delete the selected text, or the character to the right 
00874                   //of the cursor if applicable.
00875                   PlayJA2Sample( ENTERING_TEXT, RATE_11025, BTNVOLUME, 1, MIDDLEPAN );
00876                   if( Event->usKeyState & CTRL_DOWN )
00877                   {
00878                         gubStartHilite = 0;
00879                         gubEndHilite = gpActive->ubStrLen;
00880                         gfHiliteMode = TRUE;
00881                         DeleteHilitedText();
00882                   }
00883                   else if( gfHiliteMode )
00884                         PlayJA2Sample( ENTERING_TEXT, RATE_11025, BTNVOLUME, 1, MIDDLEPAN );
00885                   else
00886                         RemoveChar( gubCursorPos );
00887                   break;
00888             case BACKSPACE:
00889                   //Will delete the selected text, or the character to the left of the cursor if applicable.
00890                   if( gfHiliteMode)
00891                   {
00892                         PlayJA2Sample( ENTERING_TEXT, RATE_11025, BTNVOLUME, 1, MIDDLEPAN );
00893                         DeleteHilitedText();
00894                   }
00895                   else if( gubCursorPos > 0 )
00896                   {
00897                         PlayJA2Sample( ENTERING_TEXT, RATE_11025, BTNVOLUME, 1, MIDDLEPAN );
00898                         RemoveChar( --gubCursorPos );
00899                   }
00900                   break;
00901             default:  //check for typing keys
00902                   if( gfHiliteMode )
00903                         DeleteHilitedText();
00904                   if( gpActive->usInputType >= INPUTTYPE_EXCLUSIVE_BASEVALUE )
00905                         HandleExclusiveInput( Event->usParam );
00906                   else
00907                   {
00908                         //Use abbreviations
00909                         UINT32 key = Event->usParam;
00910                         UINT16 type = gpActive->usInputType;
00911                         //Handle space key
00912                         if( key == SPACE && type & INPUTTYPE_SPACES )
00913                         {
00914                               AddChar( key );
00915                               return TRUE;
00916                         }
00917                         //Handle allowing minus key only at the beginning of a field.
00918                         if( key == '-' && type & INPUTTYPE_FIRSTPOSMINUS && !gubCursorPos )
00919                         {
00920                               AddChar( key );
00921                               return TRUE;
00922                         }
00923                         //Handle numerics
00924                         if( key >= '0' && key <= '9' && type & INPUTTYPE_NUMERICSTRICT )
00925                         {
00926                               AddChar( key );
00927                               return TRUE;
00928                         }
00929                         //Handle alphas 
00930                         if( type & INPUTTYPE_ALPHA )
00931                         {
00932                               if( key >= 'A' && key <= 'Z' )
00933                               {
00934                                     if( type & INPUTTYPE_LOWERCASE )
00935                                           key -= 32;
00936                                     AddChar( key );
00937                                     return TRUE;
00938                               }
00939                               if( key >= 'a' && key <= 'z' )
00940                               {
00941                                     if( type & INPUTTYPE_UPPERCASE )
00942                                           key += 32;
00943                                     AddChar( key );
00944                                     return TRUE;
00945                               }
00946                         }
00947                         //Handle special characters
00948                         if( type & INPUTTYPE_SPECIAL )
00949                         {
00950                               //More can be added, but not all of the fonts support these
00951                               if( key >= 0x21 && key <= 0x2f || // ! " # $ % & ' ( ) * + , - . / 
00952                                       key >= 0x3a && key <= 0x40 || // : ; < = > ? @
00953                                           key >= 0x5b && key <= 0x5f || // [ \ ] ^ _
00954                                           key >= 0x7b && key <= 0x7d  ) // { | }
00955                               {
00956                                     AddChar( key );
00957                                     return TRUE;
00958                               }
00959                         }
00960                   }
00961                   return TRUE;
00962       }
00963       return TRUE;
00964 }
00965 
00966 void HandleExclusiveInput( UINT32 uiKey )
00967 {
00968       switch( gpActive->usInputType )
00969       {
00970             case INPUTTYPE_EXCLUSIVE_DOSFILENAME: //dos file names
00971                   if( uiKey >= 'A' && uiKey <= 'Z' || 
00972                               uiKey >= 'a' && uiKey <= 'z' ||
00973                               uiKey >= '0' && uiKey <= '9' ||
00974                               uiKey == '_' || uiKey == '.' )
00975                   {
00976                         if( !gubCursorPos && uiKey >= '0' && uiKey <= '9' )
00977                         {     //can't begin a new filename with a number
00978                               return;
00979                         }
00980                         AddChar( uiKey );
00981                   }
00982                   break;
00983             case INPUTTYPE_EXCLUSIVE_COORDINATE:  //coordinates such as a9, z78, etc.
00984                   if( !gubCursorPos ) //first char is an lower case alpha
00985                   {
00986                         if( uiKey >= 'a' && uiKey <= 'z' )
00987                               AddChar( uiKey ); 
00988                         else if( uiKey >= 'A' && uiKey <= 'Z' )
00989                               AddChar( uiKey + 32 ); //convert to lowercase
00990                   }
00991                   else //subsequent chars are numeric
00992                   {
00993                         if( uiKey >= '0' && uiKey <= '9' )
00994                               AddChar( uiKey );
00995                   }
00996                   break;
00997             case INPUTTYPE_EXCLUSIVE_24HOURCLOCK:
00998                   if( !gubCursorPos )
00999                   {
01000                         if( uiKey >= '0' && uiKey <= '2' )
01001                               AddChar( uiKey );
01002                   }
01003                   else if( gubCursorPos == 1 )
01004                   {
01005                         if( uiKey >= '0' && uiKey <= '9' )
01006                         {
01007                               if( gpActive->szString[ 0 ] == '2' && uiKey > '3' )
01008                                     break;
01009                               AddChar( uiKey );
01010                         }
01011                         if( !gpActive->szString[ 2 ] )
01012                               AddChar( ':' );
01013                         else
01014                               gubCursorPos++;
01015                   }
01016                   else if( gubCursorPos == 2 )
01017                   {
01018                         if( uiKey == ':' )
01019                               AddChar( uiKey );
01020                         else if( uiKey >= '0' && uiKey <= '9' )
01021                         {
01022                               AddChar( ':' );
01023                               AddChar( uiKey );
01024                         }     
01025                   }
01026                   else if( gubCursorPos == 3 )
01027                   {
01028                         if( uiKey >= '0' && uiKey <= '5' )
01029                               AddChar( uiKey );
01030                   }
01031                   else if( gubCursorPos == 4 )
01032                   {
01033                         if( uiKey >= '0' && uiKey <= '9' )
01034                               AddChar( uiKey );
01035                   }
01036                   break;
01037       }
01038 }
01039 
01040 void AddChar( UINT32 uiKey )
01041 {
01042       PlayJA2Sample( ENTERING_TEXT, RATE_11025, BTNVOLUME, 1, MIDDLEPAN );
01043       if( gpActive->ubStrLen >= gpActive->ubMaxChars )
01044       {     //max length reached.  Just replace the last character with new one.
01045             gpActive->ubStrLen = gpActive->ubMaxChars;
01046             gpActive->szString[ gpActive->ubStrLen-1 ] = (UINT16)uiKey;
01047             gpActive->szString[ gpActive->ubStrLen ] = '\0';
01048             return;
01049       }
01050       else if( gubCursorPos == gpActive->ubStrLen )
01051       { //add character to end
01052             gpActive->szString[ gpActive->ubStrLen ] = (UINT16)uiKey;
01053             gpActive->szString[ gpActive->ubStrLen + 1 ] = '\0';
01054             gpActive->ubStrLen++;
01055             gubCursorPos = gpActive->ubStrLen;
01056       }
01057       else
01058       { //insert character after cursor
01059             INT16 sChar;
01060             sChar = (INT16)(gpActive->ubStrLen + 1);
01061             while( sChar >= gubCursorPos )
01062             {
01063                   gpActive->szString[ sChar + 1 ] = gpActive->szString[ sChar ];
01064                   sChar--;
01065             }
01066             gpActive->szString[ gubCursorPos ] = (UINT16)uiKey;
01067             gpActive->ubStrLen++;
01068             gubCursorPos++;
01069       }
01070 }
01071 
01072 void DeleteHilitedText()
01073 {
01074       UINT8 ubCount;
01075       UINT8 ubStart, ubEnd;
01076       gfHiliteMode = FALSE;
01077       if( gubStartHilite != gubEndHilite )
01078       {
01079             if( gubStartHilite < gubEndHilite )
01080             {
01081                   ubStart = gubStartHilite;
01082                   ubEnd = gubEndHilite;
01083             }
01084             else
01085             {
01086                   ubStart = gubEndHilite;
01087                   ubEnd = gubStartHilite;
01088             }
01089             ubCount = (UINT8)(ubEnd - ubStart);
01090             while( ubCount--)
01091             {
01092                   RemoveChar( ubStart );
01093             }
01094             gubStartHilite = gubEndHilite = 0;
01095             gubCursorPos = ubStart;
01096             gfHiliteMode = FALSE;
01097       }
01098 }
01099 
01100 void RemoveChar( UINT8 ubArrayIndex )
01101 {
01102       BOOLEAN fDeleting = FALSE;
01103       while( ubArrayIndex < gpActive->ubStrLen )
01104       {
01105             gpActive->szString[ ubArrayIndex ] = gpActive->szString[ ubArrayIndex + 1 ];
01106             ubArrayIndex++;
01107             fDeleting = TRUE;
01108       }
01109       //if we deleted a char, then decrement the strlen.
01110       if( fDeleting ) 
01111             gpActive->ubStrLen--;
01112 }
01113 
01114 //Internally used to continue highlighting text
01115 void MouseMovedInTextRegionCallback(MOUSE_REGION *reg, INT32 reason)
01116 {
01117       TEXTINPUTNODE *curr;
01118       if( gfLeftButtonState )
01119       {
01120             if( reason & MSYS_CALLBACK_REASON_MOVE || 
01121                         reason & MSYS_CALLBACK_REASON_LOST_MOUSE ||
01122                         reason & MSYS_CALLBACK_REASON_GAIN_MOUSE )
01123             {
01124                   INT32 iClickX, iCurrCharPos, iNextCharPos;
01125                   UINT8 ubNewID;
01126                   ubNewID = (UINT8)MSYS_GetRegionUserData( reg, 0 );
01127                   if( ubNewID != gpActive->ubID )
01128                   { //deselect the current text edit region if applicable, then find the new one.
01129                         RenderInactiveTextFieldNode( gpActive );
01130                         curr = gpTextInputHead;
01131                         while( curr )
01132                         {     
01133                               if( curr->ubID == ubNewID )
01134                               {
01135                                     gpActive = curr;
01136                                     break;
01137                               }
01138                               curr = curr->next;
01139                         }
01140                   }
01141                   if( reason & MSYS_CALLBACK_REASON_LOST_MOUSE )
01142                   {
01143                         if( gusMouseYPos < reg->RegionTopLeftY ) 
01144                         {
01145                               gubEndHilite = 0;
01146                               gfHiliteMode = TRUE;
01147                               return;
01148                         }
01149                         else if( gusMouseYPos > reg->RegionBottomRightY )
01150                         {
01151                               gubEndHilite = gpActive->ubStrLen;
01152                               gfHiliteMode = TRUE;
01153                               return;
01154                         }
01155                   }
01156 
01157                   //Calculate the cursor position.
01158                   iClickX = gusMouseXPos - reg->RegionTopLeftX;
01159                   iCurrCharPos = 0;
01160                   gubCursorPos = 0;
01161                   iNextCharPos = StringPixLengthArg( pColors->usFont, 1, gpActive->szString ) / 2;
01162                   while( iCurrCharPos + (iNextCharPos-iCurrCharPos)/2 < iClickX && gubCursorPos < gpActive->ubStrLen )
01163                   {
01164                         gubCursorPos++;
01165                         iCurrCharPos = iNextCharPos;
01166                         iNextCharPos = StringPixLengthArg( pColors->usFont, gubCursorPos + 1, gpActive->szString );
01167                   }
01168                   gubEndHilite = gubCursorPos;
01169                   if( gubEndHilite != gubStartHilite )
01170                         gfHiliteMode = TRUE;
01171             }
01172       }
01173 }
01174 
01175 //Internally used to calculate where to place the cursor.
01176 void MouseClickedInTextRegionCallback(MOUSE_REGION *reg, INT32 reason)
01177 {
01178       TEXTINPUTNODE *curr;
01179       if( reason & MSYS_CALLBACK_REASON_LBUTTON_DWN )
01180       {
01181             INT32 iClickX, iCurrCharPos, iNextCharPos;
01182             UINT8 ubNewID;
01183             ubNewID = (UINT8)MSYS_GetRegionUserData( reg, 0 );
01184             if( ubNewID != gpActive->ubID )
01185             { //deselect the current text edit region if applicable, then find the new one.
01186                   RenderInactiveTextFieldNode( gpActive );
01187                   curr = gpTextInputHead;
01188                   while( curr )
01189                   {     
01190                         if( curr->ubID == ubNewID )
01191                         {
01192                               gpActive = curr;
01193                               break;
01194                         }
01195                         curr = curr->next;
01196                   }
01197             }
01198             //Signifies that we are typing text now.
01199             gfEditingText = TRUE;
01200             //Calculate the cursor position.
01201             iClickX = gusMouseXPos - reg->RegionTopLeftX;
01202             iCurrCharPos = 0;
01203             gubCursorPos = 0;
01204             iNextCharPos = StringPixLengthArg( pColors->usFont, 1, gpActive->szString ) / 2;
01205             while( iCurrCharPos + (iNextCharPos-iCurrCharPos)/2 < iClickX && gubCursorPos < gpActive->ubStrLen )
01206             {
01207                   gubCursorPos++;
01208                   iCurrCharPos = iNextCharPos;
01209                   iNextCharPos = StringPixLengthArg( pColors->usFont, gubCursorPos + 1, gpActive->szString );
01210             }
01211             gubStartHilite = gubCursorPos;  //This value is the anchor
01212             gubEndHilite = gubCursorPos;        //The end will move with the cursor as long as it's down.
01213             gfHiliteMode = FALSE;
01214             
01215       }
01216 }
01217 
01218 void RenderBackgroundField( TEXTINPUTNODE *pNode )
01219 {
01220       UINT16 usColor;
01221       if( pColors->fBevelling )
01222       {
01223             ColorFillVideoSurfaceArea(FRAME_BUFFER,   pNode->region.RegionTopLeftX, pNode->region.RegionTopLeftY, 
01224                                                                   pNode->region.RegionBottomRightX, pNode->region.RegionBottomRightY, pColors->usDarkerColor );
01225             ColorFillVideoSurfaceArea(FRAME_BUFFER,   pNode->region.RegionTopLeftX+1, pNode->region.RegionTopLeftY+1, 
01226                                                                   pNode->region.RegionBottomRightX, pNode->region.RegionBottomRightY, pColors->usBrighterColor );
01227       }
01228       if( !pNode->fEnabled && !pColors->fUseDisabledAutoShade )
01229             usColor = pColors->usDisabledTextFieldColor;
01230       else
01231             usColor = pColors->usTextFieldColor;
01232 
01233       ColorFillVideoSurfaceArea(FRAME_BUFFER,   pNode->region.RegionTopLeftX+1, pNode->region.RegionTopLeftY+1, 
01234                                                             pNode->region.RegionBottomRightX-1, pNode->region.RegionBottomRightY-1, usColor );
01235 
01236       InvalidateRegion( pNode->region.RegionTopLeftX, pNode->region.RegionTopLeftY, 
01237                                                             pNode->region.RegionBottomRightX, pNode->region.RegionBottomRightY );
01238 
01239 }
01240 
01241 void RenderActiveTextField()
01242 {
01243       UINT32 uiCursorXPos;
01244       UINT16 usOffset;
01245       UINT16 str[ 256 ];
01246       if( !gpActive || !gpActive->szString )
01247             return;
01248 
01249       SaveFontSettings();
01250       SetFont( pColors->usFont );
01251       usOffset = (UINT16)(( gpActive->region.RegionBottomRightY - gpActive->region.RegionTopLeftY - GetFontHeight( pColors->usFont ) ) / 2);
01252       RenderBackgroundField( gpActive );
01253       if( gfHiliteMode && gubStartHilite != gubEndHilite )
01254       { //Some or all of the text is hilighted, so we will use a different method.
01255             UINT16 i;
01256             UINT16 usStart, usEnd;
01257             //sort the hilite order.
01258             if( gubStartHilite < gubEndHilite )
01259             {
01260                   usStart = gubStartHilite;
01261                   usEnd = gubEndHilite;
01262             }
01263             else
01264             {
01265                   usStart = gubEndHilite;
01266                   usEnd = gubStartHilite;
01267             }
01268             //Traverse the string one character at a time, and draw the highlited part differently.
01269             for( i = 0; i < gpActive->ubStrLen; i++ )
01270             {
01271                   uiCursorXPos = StringPixLengthArg( pColors->usFont, i, gpActive->szString ) + 3;
01272                   if( i >= usStart && i < usEnd )
01273                   { //in highlighted part of text
01274                         SetFontForeground( pColors->ubHiForeColor );
01275                         SetFontShadow( pColors->ubHiShadowColor );
01276                         SetFontBackground( pColors->ubHiBackColor );
01277                   }
01278                   else
01279                   { //in regular part of text
01280                         SetFontForeground( pColors->ubForeColor );
01281                         SetFontShadow( pColors->ubShadowColor );
01282                         SetFontBackground( 0 );
01283                   }
01284                   if( gpActive->szString[i] != '%' )
01285                   {
01286                         mprintf( uiCursorXPos + gpActive->region.RegionTopLeftX, gpActive->region.RegionTopLeftY + usOffset, L"%c", gpActive->szString[i] );
01287                   }
01288                   else
01289                   {
01290                         mprintf( uiCursorXPos + gpActive->region.RegionTopLeftX, gpActive->region.RegionTopLeftY + usOffset, L"%%" );
01291                   }
01292             }
01293       }
01294       else
01295       {
01296             SetFontForeground( pColors->ubForeColor );
01297             SetFontShadow( pColors->ubShadowColor );
01298             SetFontBackground( 0 );
01299             DoublePercentileCharacterFromStringIntoString( gpActive->szString, str );
01300             mprintf( gpActive->region.RegionTopLeftX + 3, gpActive->region.RegionTopLeftY + usOffset, str );
01301       }
01302       //Draw the cursor in the correct position.
01303       if( gfEditingText && gpActive->szString )
01304       {
01305             DoublePercentileCharacterFromStringIntoString( gpActive->szString, str );
01306             uiCursorXPos = StringPixLengthArg( pColors->usFont, gubCursorPos, str ) + 2;
01307             if( GetJA2Clock()%1000 < 500 )
01308             {     //draw the blinking ibeam cursor during the on blink period.
01309                   ColorFillVideoSurfaceArea(FRAME_BUFFER, 
01310                         gpActive->region.RegionTopLeftX + uiCursorXPos, 
01311                         gpActive->region.RegionTopLeftY + usOffset, 
01312                         gpActive->region.RegionTopLeftX + uiCursorXPos + 1, 
01313                         gpActive->region.RegionTopLeftY + usOffset + GetFontHeight( pColors->usFont ), pColors->usCursorColor );
01314             }
01315       }
01316       RestoreFontSettings();
01317 }
01318 
01319 void RenderInactiveTextField( UINT8 ubID )
01320 {
01321       UINT16 usOffset;
01322       TEXTINPUTNODE* pNode, *curr;
01323       UINT16 str[ 256 ];
01324       curr = gpTextInputHead;
01325       pNode = NULL;
01326       while( curr )
01327       {
01328             if( curr->ubID == ubID )
01329             {
01330                   pNode = curr;
01331                   break;
01332             }
01333       }
01334       if( !pNode || !pNode->szString )
01335             return;
01336       SaveFontSettings();
01337       SetFont( pColors->usFont );
01338       usOffset = (UINT16)(( pNode->region.RegionBottomRightY - pNode->region.RegionTopLeftY - GetFontHeight( pColors->usFont ) ) / 2);
01339       SetFontForeground( pColors->ubForeColor );
01340       SetFontShadow( pColors->ubShadowColor );
01341       SetFontBackground( 0 );
01342       RenderBackgroundField( pNode );
01343       DoublePercentileCharacterFromStringIntoString( pNode->szString, str );
01344       mprintf( pNode->region.RegionTopLeftX + 3, pNode->region.RegionTopLeftY + usOffset, str );
01345       RestoreFontSettings();
01346 }
01347 
01348 void RenderInactiveTextFieldNode( TEXTINPUTNODE *pNode )
01349 {
01350       UINT16 usOffset;
01351       UINT16 str[ 256 ];
01352       if( !pNode || !pNode->szString )
01353             return;
01354       SaveFontSettings();
01355       SetFont( pColors->usFont );
01356       if( !pNode->fEnabled && pColors->fUseDisabledAutoShade )
01357       { //use the color scheme specified by the user.
01358             SetFontForeground( pColors->ubDisabledForeColor );
01359             SetFontShadow( pColors->ubDisabledShadowColor );
01360       }
01361       else
01362       {
01363             SetFontForeground( pColors->ubForeColor );
01364             SetFontShadow( pColors->ubShadowColor );
01365       }
01366       usOffset = (UINT16)(( pNode->region.RegionBottomRightY - pNode->region.RegionTopLeftY - GetFontHeight( pColors->usFont ) ) / 2);
01367       SetFontBackground( 0 );
01368       RenderBackgroundField( pNode );
01369       DoublePercentileCharacterFromStringIntoString( pNode->szString, str );
01370       mprintf( pNode->region.RegionTopLeftX + 3, pNode->region.RegionTopLeftY + usOffset, str );
01371       RestoreFontSettings();
01372       if( !pNode->fEnabled && pColors->fUseDisabledAutoShade )
01373       {
01374             UINT8 *pDestBuf;
01375             UINT32 uiDestPitchBYTES;
01376             SGPRect ClipRect;
01377             ClipRect.iLeft = pNode->region.RegionTopLeftX;
01378             ClipRect.iRight = pNode->region.RegionBottomRightX;
01379             ClipRect.iTop = pNode->region.RegionTopLeftY;
01380             ClipRect.iBottom = pNode->region.RegionBottomRightY;
01381             pDestBuf = LockVideoSurface( FRAME_BUFFER, &uiDestPitchBYTES );
01382             Blt16BPPBufferShadowRect( (UINT16*)pDestBuf, uiDestPitchBYTES, &ClipRect );
01383             UnLockVideoSurface( FRAME_BUFFER );
01384       }
01385 }
01386 
01387 //Use when you do a full interface update.
01388 void RenderAllTextFields()
01389 {
01390       STACKTEXTINPUTNODE *stackCurr;
01391       TEXTINPUTNODE *curr;
01392       //Render all of the other text input levels first,
01393       //if they exist at all.
01394       stackCurr = pInputStack;
01395       while( stackCurr )
01396       {
01397             curr = stackCurr->head;
01398             while( curr )
01399             {
01400                   RenderInactiveTextFieldNode( curr );
01401                   curr = curr->next;
01402             }
01403             stackCurr = stackCurr->next;
01404       }
01405       //Render the current text input level
01406       curr = gpTextInputHead;
01407       while( curr )
01408       {
01409             if( curr != gpActive )
01410                   RenderInactiveTextFieldNode( curr );
01411             else
01412                   RenderActiveTextField();
01413             curr = curr->next;
01414       }
01415 }
01416 
01417 void EnableTextField( UINT8 ubID )
01418 {
01419       TEXTINPUTNODE *curr;
01420   curr = gpTextInputHead;
01421       while( curr )
01422       {
01423             if( curr->ubID == ubID )
01424             {
01425                   if( !curr->fEnabled )
01426                   {
01427                         if( !gpActive )
01428                               gpActive = curr;
01429                         MSYS_EnableRegion( &curr->region );
01430                         curr->fEnabled = TRUE;
01431                   }
01432                   else
01433                         return;
01434             }
01435             curr = curr->next;
01436       }
01437 }
01438 
01439 void DisableTextField( UINT8 ubID )
01440 {
01441       TEXTINPUTNODE *curr;
01442   curr = gpTextInputHead;
01443       while( curr )
01444       {
01445             if( curr->ubID == ubID )
01446             {
01447                   if( gpActive == curr )
01448                         SelectNextField();
01449                   if( curr->fEnabled )
01450                   {
01451                         MSYS_DisableRegion( &curr->region );
01452                         curr->fEnabled = FALSE;
01453                   }
01454                   else
01455                         return;
01456             }
01457             curr = curr->next;
01458       }
01459 }

01466       {
01467             if( curr->ubID >= ubFirstID && curr->ubID <= ubLastID )
01468             {
01469                   if( gpActive == curr )
01470                         SelectNextField();
01471                   if( !curr->fEnabled )
01472                   {
01473                         MSYS_EnableRegion( &curr->region );
01474                         curr->fEnabled = TRUE;
01475                   }
01476             }
01477             curr = curr->next;
01478       }
01479 }

01545 //copy, cut, and paste hilighted text code
01546 void InitClipboard()
01547 {
01548       szClipboard = NULL;
01549 }
01550 
01551 void KillClipboard()
01552 {
01553       if( szClipboard )
01554       {
01555             MemFree( szClipboard );
01556             szClipboard = NULL;
01557       }
01558 }
01559 
01560 void ExecuteCopyCommand()
01561 {
01562       UINT8 ubCount;
01563       UINT8 ubStart, ubEnd;
01564       if( !gpActive || !gpActive->szString )
01565             return;
01566       //Delete the current contents in the clipboard
01567       KillClipboard();
01568       //Calculate the start and end of the hilight
01569       if( gubStartHilite != gubEndHilite )
01570       {
01571             if( gubStartHilite < gubEndHilite )
01572             {
01573                   ubStart = gubStartHilite;
01574                   ubEnd = gubEndHilite;
01575             }
01576             else
01577             {
01578                   ubStart = gubEndHilite;
01579                   ubEnd = gubStartHilite;
01580             }
01581             ubCount = (UINT8)(ubEnd - ubStart);
01582             szClipboard = (UINT16*)MemAlloc( ( ubCount + 1 ) * 2 );
01583             Assert( szClipboard );
01584             for( ubCount = ubStart; ubCount < ubEnd; ubCount++ )
01585             {
01586                   szClipboard[ ubCount-ubStart ] = gpActive->szString[ ubCount ];
01587             }
01588             szClipboard[ ubCount-ubStart ] = L'\0';
01589       }
01590 }
01591 
01592 void ExecutePasteCommand()
01593 {
01594       UINT8 ubCount;
01595       if( !gpActive || !szClipboard )
01596             return;
01597       DeleteHilitedText();
01598       
01599       ubCount = 0;
01600       while( szClipboard[ ubCount ] )
01601       {     
01602             AddChar( szClipboard[ ubCount ] );
01603             ubCount++;
01604       }
01605 }
01606 
01607 void ExecuteCutCommand()
01608 {
01609       ExecuteCopyCommand();
01610       DeleteHilitedText();
01611 }

01613 //Saves the current text input mode, then removes it and activates the previous text input mode,
01614 //if applicable.  The second function restores the settings.  Doesn't currently support nested
01615 //calls.
01616 void SaveAndRemoveCurrentTextInputMode()
01617 {
01618       if( pSavedHead )
01619             AssertMsg( 0, "Attempting to save text input stack head, when one already exists.");
01620       pSavedHead = gpTextInputHead;
01621       pSavedColors = pColors;
01622       if( pInputStack )
01623       {
01624             gpTextInputHead = pInputStack->head;
01625             pColors = pInputStack->pColors;
01626       }
01627       else
01628       {
01629             gpTextInputHead = NULL;
01630             pColors = NULL;
01631       }
01632 }
01633 
01634 void RestoreSavedTextInputMode()
01635 {
01636       if( !pSavedHead )
01637             AssertMsg( 0, "Attempting to restore saved text input stack head, when one doesn't exist.");
01638   gpTextInputHead = pSavedHead;
01639       pColors = pSavedColors;
01640       pSavedHead = NULL;
01641       pSavedColors = NULL;
01642 }

01644 UINT16 GetTextInputCursor()
01645 {
01646       return gusTextInputCursor;    
01647 }
01648 
01649 void SetTextInputCursor( UINT16 usNewCursor )
01650 {
01651       STACKTEXTINPUTNODE *stackCurr;
01652       TEXTINPUTNODE *curr;
01653       if(   gusTextInputCursor == usNewCursor )
01654       {
01655             return;
01656       }
01657       gusTextInputCursor = usNewCursor;
01658       //Render all of the other text input levels first,
01659       //if they exist at all.
01660       stackCurr = pInputStack;
01661       while( stackCurr )
01662       {
01663             curr = stackCurr->head;
01664             while( curr )
01665             {
01666                   MSYS_SetCurrentCursor( usNewCursor );
01667                   curr = curr->next;
01668             }
01669             stackCurr = stackCurr->next;
01670       }
01671       //Render the current text input level
01672       curr = gpTextInputHead;
01673       while( curr )
01674       {
01675             MSYS_SetCurrentCursor( usNewCursor );
01676             curr = curr->next;
01677       }
01678 }
01679 
01680 //Utility functions for the INPUTTYPE_EXCLUSIVE_24HOURCLOCK input type.
01681 UINT16 GetExclusive24HourTimeValueFromField( UINT8 ubField )
01682 {
01683       TEXTINPUTNODE *curr;
01684       UINT16 usTime;
01685       curr = gpTextInputHead;
01686       while( curr )
01687       {
01688             if( curr->ubID == ubField )
01689             {
01690                   if( curr->usInputType != INPUTTYPE_EXCLUSIVE_24HOURCLOCK )
01691                         return 0xffff; //illegal!
01692                   //First validate the hours 00-23
01693                   if( curr->szString[0] == '2' && curr->szString[1] >= '0' &&       //20-23
01694                               curr->szString[1] <='3' ||
01695                               curr->szString[0] >= '0' && curr->szString[0] <= '1' &&           // 00-19
01696                           curr->szString[1] >= '0' && curr->szString[1] <= '9' )           
01697                   { //Next, validate the colon, and the minutes 00-59
01698                         if(   curr->szString[2] == ':' &&   curr->szString[5] == 0   &&   //    :
01699                                     curr->szString[3] >= '0' && curr->szString[3] <= '5' &&     // 0-5
01700                                     curr->szString[4] >= '0' && curr->szString[4] <= '9' )      // 0-9
01701                         {
01702                               //Hours
01703                               usTime = ((curr->szString[0]-0x30) * 10 + curr->szString[1]-0x30) * 60;
01704                               //Minutes
01705                               usTime += (curr->szString[3]-0x30) * 10 + curr->szString[4]-0x30;
01706                               return usTime;
01707                         }
01708                   }
01709                   // invalid
01710                   return 0xffff;
01711             }
01712             curr = curr->next;
01713       }
01714 
01715       AssertMsg( FALSE, String( "GetExclusive24HourTimeValueFromField: Invalid field %d", ubField ) );
01716       return 0xffff;
01717 }
01718 
01719 //Utility functions for the INPUTTYPE_EXCLUSIVE_24HOURCLOCK input type.
01720 void SetExclusive24HourTimeValue( UINT8 ubField, UINT16 usTime )
01721 {
01722       TEXTINPUTNODE *curr;
01723       //First make sure the time is a valid time.  If not, then use 23:59
01724       if( usTime == 0xffff )
01725       {
01726             SetInputFieldStringWith16BitString( ubField, L"" );
01727             return;
01728       }
01729       usTime = min( 1439, usTime );
01730       curr = gpTextInputHead;
01731       while( curr )
01732       {
01733             if( curr->ubID == ubField )
01734             {
01735                   if( curr->fUserField )
01736                         AssertMsg( 0, String( "Attempting to illegally set text into user field %d", curr->ubID ) );
01737                   curr->szString[0] = (usTime / 600) + 0x30;                  //10 hours
01738                   curr->szString[1] = (usTime / 60 % 10) + 0x30;  //1 hour
01739                   usTime %= 60;                                                                                                           //truncate the hours
01740                   curr->szString[2] = ':';
01741                   curr->szString[3] = (usTime / 10) + 0x30;                   //10 minutes
01742                   curr->szString[4] = (usTime % 10) + 0x30;                   //1 minute;
01743                   curr->szString[5] = 0;
01744                   return;
01745             }
01746             curr = curr->next;
01747       }
01748 }
01749 
01750 void DoublePercentileCharacterFromStringIntoString( UINT16 *pSrcString, UINT16 *pDstString )
01751 {
01752       INT32 iSrcIndex = 0, iDstIndex = 0;
01753       while( pSrcString[ iSrcIndex ] != 0 )
01754       {
01755             if( pSrcString[ iSrcIndex ] == '%' )
01756             {
01757                   pDstString[ iDstIndex ] = '%';
01758                   iDstIndex++;
01759             }
01760             pDstString[ iDstIndex ] = pSrcString[ iSrcIndex ];
01761             iSrcIndex++, iDstIndex++;
01762       }
01763       pDstString[ iDstIndex ] = 0;
01764 }
